p: L. paniculata is an endemic shrub, growing wild between 2000 and 2500 m above sea level. It has been described in the Ecuadorian provinces of Azuay and Loja. Synonyms of this species are: Alguelagum paniculatum (Kunth.) Kuntze, Sideritis paniculata Kunth, and Sphacele paniculata (Kunth) Benth. [ 19]. According to some literature, an accepted name is Lepechinia betonicifolia (Lam.) Epling [ 20], although other sources consider it as a different species [ 14]. An EO of this plant has already been studied [ 21].
